The Houston Rockets cruised to a 127-100 victory over the San Antonio Spurs.
Eason buried a corner 3 to give the Rockets their first 20-point lead at 46-26.
VanVleet finished 10 of 11 from the floor, including 9 for 9 from inside the arc.
VanVleet's defense was elite, preventing Chris Paul from doing any serious damage.
Fred VanVleet recorded his first double-double of the season with 21 points and 10 assists.

VanVleet's full-court pass to Jabari Smith Jr. resulted in a dunk and a 22-8 lead in the first period.
The Houston Rockets came away with their second straight win last night against the San Antonio Spurs, 127-100.
Chris Paul and Julian Champagnie combined for three 3-pointers to cut the deficit to 67-51 in the third quarter.
Alperen Sengun finished with 16 points, five rebounds, four assists, one steal, and two blocks in just 24 minutes.
Jalen Green and Fred VanVleet also contributed significantly, each adding 21 points, with VanVleet also dishing out 10 assists.
